title: Immune system protein prompts obese mice to 'sweat' out fat, inspiring new treatment target
author: Arlene Weintraub
description: The cytokine TSLP is an immune system protein known to play a role in some allergic diseases, and a research team at the University of Pennsylvania has been investigating whether it also influences | University of Pennsylvania researchers found that boosting levels of the cytokine TSLP in obese mice reduced their risk of developing Type 2 diabetes and caused them to lose 44% of their weight in 28 days. The weight loss was caused by the release of oil from the skin, making the "sweating out" of fat a potential strategy in treating obesity, they suggested.
